cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 15 mi WNW of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across Hispaniola, then over or near Cuba and into the Gulf of Mexico toward the U.S. north-central Gulf Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Central Bahamas, Andros Island, Florida Keys (Ocean Reef to Key West and Dry Tortugas), Florida Bay, and much of western and central Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Northern and southern coasts of the Dominican Republic, northern coast of Haiti, southeastern Bahamas, Turks and Caicos Islands, and eastern Cuban provinces (Camaguey eastward)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greater Antilles (Puerto Rico, Dominican Republic, Haiti, Cuba), southeastern Bahamas, Turks and Caicos, and later the northern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (gusts 40–50 mph) affected the port Saturday evening before diminishing overnight.
weather_observation.rainfall: Total rainfall 4–8 inches possible, causing flash flooding and minor to moderate river rises around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough surf and dangerous rip currents; localized mudslides possible in steep terrain surrounding the port.
